abstract: Proponents of immigration overhaul legislation are counting on representatives of farm districts, many of whom are Republicans, to form a key bloc of support in the House; representatives advocate guest worker program for agriculture that will provide farmers with legal work force they need to fill jobs that Americans are not willing to do.
lead_paragraph: Proponents of an immigration overhaul are counting on representatives of farm-heavy districts, many of whom are Republicans, to form a key bloc of support in the House.

headline.main: Fate of the Immigration Bill May Hinge on Farm Districts
headline.print_headline: Fate of the Immigration Bill May Hinge on Farm Districts
headline.seo: Immigration Bill’s Fate May Hinge on Farm Districts

snippet: Proponents of an immigration overhaul are counting on representatives of farm-heavy districts, many of whom are Republicans, to form a key bloc of support in the House....
